page.title: 10FEATURES PAST & PRESENT
page.content: {PRINCIPAL FEATURES PAST & PRESENT BEAUPRE HALL GROUPED HOMES Beaupre Hall is named after a famous Outwell family who lived in a medieval manor house near Wisbech Road in the 15th century. The manor house was demolished in 1966. The Grouped home for the elderly was built in 1973 by the Kings Lynn and West Norfolk District Council. There are 29 residents,including 3 couples. The ages of the residents range from 78 to 93. Mrs. Stanford is the current Warden, Mrs. Setchell is the Deputy Warden and there are 3 home helpers. Mrs. Stanford's day begins at 7.00a.m. when she does her rounds to check if each resident is alright. Either Mrs. Stanford or Mrs. Setchell has to remain on the premises during the day. Their day finishes at 10.00p.m. when the building is locked up.
